VIM Buffer History 1.0.0 A vim plugin to maintain a MRU buffer jump history per window Getting Started Installation Install this like any other nvim plugin based on the plugin manager you use VIM API Buffer History provides the following vim commands : - : Lists the window local history of buffers visited buffers stack - : Jumps to previously visited buffer - : Jumps forward to next visited buffer when you're not already on the last one These are also available as the following plug mappings : - : Set to <kbd>gbl</kbd> by default - : Set to <kbd>gbp</kbd> by default - : Set to <kbd>gbn</kbd> by default You can override these mappings by setting them in your vim configurations Credits This plugin took inspiration from https://github.com/ton/vim-bufsurf, with a cleaner and simpler approach to the problem.
